description: Parameters needed to the corresponding task specification in eTaSL

from-core_task_lib-version-0.1.0.description:
Library core_task_lib version 0.1.0.
 Set to true to indicate that task specification comes from the library above. 
 Library description: Library with basic task specifications that may be needed in most applications
Authors: Santiago Iregui (KU Leuven), Erwin AertbeliÃ«n (KU Leuven), Federico Ulloa (KU Leuven)

file_path.description: File path of the corresponding task specification

parameters.description: List of parameters needed to define an instance of the task specification

desired_pose.description:
Array with the desired pose of the task frame in [x,y,z,qx,qy,qz,qw]. 
Set as a string beginning with $blackboard such as `$blackboard/output_param/my_task/my_param` if the value is not yet known and thus will be set externally at runtime (only once) depending on e.g. the outcome of a previous action or the outcome of another module.
Set as $application_defined_parameter to indicate that the parameter is defined by the application and not by the skill specification.

error_pos_th.description:
Position error threshold for monitoring [m]. 
Set as a string beginning with $blackboard such as `$blackboard/output_param/my_task/my_param` if the value is not yet known and thus will be set externally at runtime (only once) depending on e.g. the outcome of a previous action or the outcome of another module.
Set as $application_defined_parameter to indicate that the parameter is defined by the application and not by the skill specification.

eq_r.description:
Equivalent radius [m]. 
Set as a string beginning with $blackboard such as `$blackboard/output_param/my_task/my_param` if the value is not yet known and thus will be set externally at runtime (only once) depending on e.g. the outcome of a previous action or the outcome of another module.
Set as $application_defined_parameter to indicate that the parameter is defined by the application and not by the skill specification.

maxacc.description:
Maximum acceleration [m/s^2]. 
Set as a string beginning with $blackboard such as `$blackboard/output_param/my_task/my_param` if the value is not yet known and thus will be set externally at runtime (only once) depending on e.g. the outcome of a previous action or the outcome of another module.
Set as $application_defined_parameter to indicate that the parameter is defined by the application and not by the skill specification.

task_frame.description:
Name of frame used to control the robot in cartesian space. 
Set as a string beginning with $blackboard such as `$blackboard/output_param/my_task/my_param` if the value is not yet known and thus will be set externally at runtime (only once) depending on e.g. the outcome of a previous action or the outcome of another module.
Set as $application_defined_parameter to indicate that the parameter is defined by the application and not by the skill specification.

error_rot_th.description:
Rotation error threshold for monitoring [rad]. 
Set as a string beginning with $blackboard such as `$blackboard/output_param/my_task/my_param` if the value is not yet known and thus will be set externally at runtime (only once) depending on e.g. the outcome of a previous action or the outcome of another module.
Set as $application_defined_parameter to indicate that the parameter is defined by the application and not by the skill specification.

maxvel.description:
Maximum velocity [m/s]. 
Set as a string beginning with $blackboard such as `$blackboard/output_param/my_task/my_param` if the value is not yet known and thus will be set externally at runtime (only once) depending on e.g. the outcome of a previous action or the outcome of another module.
Set as $application_defined_parameter to indicate that the parameter is defined by the application and not by the skill specification.

is-move_cartesianspace_absolute_pose.description:
Task Specification: move_cartesianspace_absolute_pose.etasl.lua
Set to true to indicate that the task uses the task specification mentioned above. 
 Task description: This task specification allows to a desired task frame to a desired pose in cartesian space.

title: Task Specification Configuration
